title: Operation First Light
description: Welcome to DIS Selection. A foreign intelligence signal has been intercepted and something big is being planned. HQ needs fresh eyes on the case. This is your audition, recruit. Prove you belong in the C4X.
storyContext: You just walked into DIS headquarters for the first time. The briefing room lights are low. A screen flickers to life showing encrypted transmissions from an unknown source. Your commanding officer says: 'We intercepted a burst transmission 3 hours ago. Nobody on the senior team can crack the pattern. That's why you're here. Fresh perspective, no baggage. Show us what the next generation of digital intelligence looks like.'

software-engineer.title: Crack the Signal
software-engineer.instruction: The intercepted transmission is garbled. Looks like someone scrambled it through 5 layers of encoding. You need to peel back each layer in the right order to reveal the original message. Get the sequence wrong and you'll corrupt the data permanently. HQ is watching your screen live!

items.label: Capture the raw signal and save an unaltered copy before touching anything
Identify the encoding pattern to figure out what language the scramble is written in
Strip the outer noise layer to remove the static and junk data hiding the real content
Decode the core message by applying the right key to unlock the actual transmission
Verify message integrity and confirm the decoded message is complete and untampered

data-scientist.title: Predict the Next Transmission
data-scientist.instruction: Intel has logged 4 previous burst transmissions from this source. The pattern isn't random, there's a rhythm to it. Predict when the NEXT transmission will happen (in minutes from now) so the signals team can have their equipment pointed in the right direction. If you're within range, we catch it live!

cloud-engineer.title: Set Up the Listening Post
cloud-engineer.instruction: HQ wants a digital listening post set up to monitor this target 24/7. But we have limited equipment and the target could go silent or go loud at any moment. How do you build the monitoring station?

options.label: Go full spectrum. Monitor every frequency, every channel, all the time. Nothing slips through, but it burns through power and storage like crazy. Think of it as leaving every camera in a building recording 24/7.
Set up smart triggers. Only activate full monitoring when the system detects unusual activity. Saves resources but might miss the first few seconds of a surprise transmission.

Deploy a distributed sensor network. Place multiple small listening devices across different locations. If one goes down, the others still hear. Like having undercover agents at every exit of a building.
Tap into the ally sharing network. Partner with allied intelligence services who already have monitoring in the area. You get coverage immediately but you share everything you find.
